div0.head: Ι

div1.head: ἰαιβοῖ
div1.sense: Comic exclamation for αἰβοῖ, Ar.

div1.head: ἰαίνω
div1.sense: to heat, Od.
to melt:—Pass. to be melted, Od.
to warm, cheer, Lat. fovere, θυμὸν ἰαίνειν Od., etc.:—Pass., ἐν φρεσὶ θυμὸς ἰάνθη Od.; μέτωπον ἰάνθη her brow unfolded, Il.; c. dat. rei, to take delight in, Od.

div1.head: Ἰακχάζω
div1.sense: to shout Ἴακχος; c. acc. cogn., ἰακχάζειν φωνήν to utter the cry Ἴακχος, Hdt.

div1.head: Ἰακχεῖον
div1.sense: a temple of Bacchus, Plut.

div1.head: ἰάκχιος
div1.sense: Bacchanalian, Soph.

div1.head: Ἴακχος
div1.sense: Iacchus, mystic name of Bacchus, Ar., etc.
a festal song in his honour, Hdt., etc.

div1.head: ἰαλεμίστρια
div1.sense: a wailing woman, Aesch.

div1.head: ἰάλεμος
div1.sense: a wail, lament, dirge, Aesch., Eur.
as adj., hapless, melancholy, Theocr.

div1.head: ἰάλλω
div1.sense: to send forth, ὀϊστὸν ἀπὸ νευρῆφιν ἴαλλεν Il.; ἐπʼ ὀνείατα χεῖρας ἴαλλον they put forth their hands to the dishes, Hom.; περὶ χερσὶ δεσμὸν ἴηλα threw chains around thy arms, Il.
to attack, assail, ἀτιμίηισιν ἰάλλειν τινά to assail him with reproaches, Od.
to send, Theogn., Aesch.
intr. (sub. ἑαυτόν), to send oneself on, i. e. to flee, run, fly, Hes.

div1.head: ἰαλτός
div1.sense: sent forth, Aesch.

div1.head: ἴαμα
div1.sense: a means of healing, remedy, medicine, Hdt., Thuc.
= ἴασις, NTest.

div1.head: ἰαμβεῖος
div1.sense: iambic, μέτρον Arist.
as Subst., ἰαμβεῖον, ου, τό, an iambic verse, Ar., Plat.
iambic metre, Arist.

div1.head: ἰαμβειοφάγος
div1.sense: a glutton at iambics, or perhaps a murderer of them, Dem.

div1.head: ἰαμβίζω
div1.sense: to assail in iambics, to lampoon, Arist.

div1.head: ἰαμβικός
div1.sense: iambic, Arist.

div1.head: ἰαμβοποιέω
div1.sense: to write iambics, Arist.

div1.head: ἰαμβοποιός
div1.sense: a writer of iambics, Arist.

div1.head: ἴαμβος
div1.sense: an iambus, a metrical foot consisting of a short and long syll., as ἐγώ, Plat., etc.
an iambic verse, the trimeter or senarius, Hdt., Ar.
an iambic poem, lampoon, Plat.
div1.etym: From ἰάπτω 2, because iambics were first used by the satiric poets Archilochus and Hipponax; criminosi iambi, Hor.

div1.head: Ἰάν
div1.sense: an Ionian, Aesch. [who has gen. pl. Ἰάνων with ᾰ].

div1.head: ἰάομαι
div1.etym: Pass., v. infr. [ῑᾱ Hom., etc.,; later also ι
div1.sense: to heal, cure, Hom., etc.:— metaph., ἀδικίαν ἰᾶσθαι Eur.: proverb., μὴ τῶι κακῶι τὸ κακὸν ἰῶ, i. e. do not make bad worse, Hdt.
the aor1 ἰάθην [ᾱ] is always pass., to be healed, to recover, Andoc., NTest.; so perf. ἴᾱμαι NTest.

div1.head: Ἰαοναῦ
div1.sense: O Ionian, Ar.

div1.head: Ἰάονες
div1.sense: the Ionians, including, Il.:—in Persian it was = Ἕλληνες, Aesch.:— sg. Ἰάων rare, Theocr.

div1.head: Ἰαόνιος
div1.sense: Ionian, Greek, Aesch.; Athenian, Orac. ap. Plut.

div1.head: ἰά
div1.sense: a voice, cry, Orac. ap. Hdt., Aesch., Eur.

div1.head: ἰάπτω
div1.sense: to send on, put forth, Hom.; κατὰ χρόα ἰάπτειν (sc. τὰς χεῖρας) to put forth (her hands) against her body, i. e. smite her breasts for grief, Od.: —of missiles, to send forth, shoot, Aesch.; ἰάπτειν ὀρχήματα to begin the dance, Soph.
to assail, attack, Soph.: to wound, ἰ. τινὰ ἐς ὀστέον ἄχρις Theocr.; Pass., ἰάπτομαι ἄλγεσιν ἦτορ Mosch.

div1.head: Ἰάπυγες
div1.sense: a people of Southern Italy, Hdt.

div1.head: Ἰαπυγία
div1.sense: the country of the Iapygians, a people of Southern Italy, Hdt.

div1.head: Ἰαπύγιος
div1.sense: Iapygian, Thuc.

div1.head: Ἰᾶπυξ
div1.sense: the NW or WNW wind, Arist.

div1.head: ἰάσιμος
div1.sense: to be cured, curable, opp. to ἀνίατος, Aesch., Plat., etc.: metaph. appeasable, Eur.

div1.head: ἴασις
div1.sense: healing, a mode of healing, cure, remedy, Lat. medela, Soph., Plat., etc.

div1.head: Ἰάς
div1.sense: Ionian, Ionic, Hdt., Thuc.
as Subst. (sub. γυνή) , an Ionian woman, Hdt.
(sub. γλῶσσα) the Ionic dialect, Luc.

div1.head: ἴασπις
div1.sense: jasper, Plat. (A foreign word.)

div1.head: Ἰαστί
div1.sense: in Ionic fashion, Plat.
in the Ionic mode (of music), Plat.
in the Ionic dialect, Luc.

div1.head: Ἰασώ
div1.sense: Iaso, the goddess of healing, Ar.

div1.head: ἰατήρ
div1.sense: doctor, healer, metaph., ἰ. κακῶν Od., Soph.

div1.head: ἰατορία
div1.sense: the art of healing, surgery, Soph.

div1.head: ἰατός
div1.sense: curable, Pind., Plat.

div1.head: ἰατρεία
div1.sense: medical treatment: metaph. a curing, correcting, Arist.

div1.head: ἰατρεῖον
div1.sense: a surgery, Plat., etc.

div1.head: ἰάτρευμα
div1.sense: in Rhet. a means of healing disaffection in the hearers, Arist.

div1.head: ἰατρεύω
div1.sense: to treat medically, to cure, Plat.:—Pass. to be under medical care, Plat.
absol. to practise medicine, Arist.

div1.head: ἰατρικός
div1.sense: of or for a surgeon: — ἡ -κή (sc. τέχνη) , surgery, medicine, Hdt., Plat., etc.
skilled in the medical art, Plat.: metaph., ἰ. περὶ τὴν ψυχήν Plat.

div1.head: ἰατρόμαντις
div1.sense: physician and seer, of Apollo and Aesculapius, Aesch., Ar.: metaph., Ar.

div1.head: ἰατρός
div1.sense: like ἰατήρ, one who heals, a mediciner, physician or surgeon (for there seems to have been no professional distinction), Il., etc.: — ἰ. ὀφθαλμῶν, ὀδόντων an oculist, dentist, Hdt.
metaph., ἰατρ. πόνων Pind.; ὀργῆς Aesch.

div1.head: ἰατροτέχνης
div1.sense: a practiser of medicine, Ar.

div1.head: ἰατταταῖ
div1.sense: alas! ah! woeʼs me! Ar.; so, ἰατταταιάξ, Ar.

div1.head: ἰαυοῖ
div1.sense: exclamation of joy, ho ho! Ar.

div1.head: ἰαῦ
div1.sense: a shout in answer to one calling, ho! holla! Ar.

div1.head: ἰαύω
div1.sense: to sleep, to pass the night, Hom.:—c. acc. cogn., ἐννυχίαν τέρψιν ἰαύειν to enjoy the nightʼs sleep, Soph.

div1.head: ἰαφέτης
div1.sense: an archer, Anth.

div1.head: ἰαχέω
div1.sense: to cry, shout, shriek, like ἰάχω, Eur., etc.:—c. acc. cogn., ἰαχεῖν μέλος Eur.; ἀοιδάν Ar.
to bewail, lament, Eur.
of things, to sound, Hhymn., Eur.

div1.head: ἰάχημα
div1.sense: a cry: the hissing of a serpent, Eur.: the sound of an instrument, Anth.

div1.head: ἰαχή
div1.sense: a cry, shout, wail, shriek, Hom.: also a joyous sound, ἰαχὰ ὑμεναίων Pind., Trag.

div1.head: ἰάχω
div1.sense: to cry, shout, shriek, in sign either of joy or grief, like ἰαχέω, Hom.; of articulate speech, Eur., Anth.
of things, to ring, resound, Hom.; of waves and of fire, to roar, Hom.; of a bowstring, to twang, Il.; of hot iron in water, to hiss, Od.
c. acc. cogn., ἰ. ἀοιδήν, μέλος to sound forth a strain, Hhymn.; ἰ. λογίων ὁδόν to proclaim the sense of oracles, Ar.; ἴαχον Ἀπόλλω were sounding his praises, Ar.

div1.head: ἶβις
div1.sense: the ibis, an Egyptian bird, Hdt., Ar.

div1.head: ἴγδις
div1.sense: a mortar, Solon., Anth.

div1.head: ἰγνύα
div1.sense: the part behind the thigh and knee, the ham, Lat. poples, Il., Theocr.

div1.head: Ἰδαῖος
div1.sense: of Ida, Il.

div1.head: ἰδάλιμος
div1.sense: causing sweat, Hes.

div1.head: ἰδέα
div1.sense: = εἶδος, form, Pind., Ar., etc.
the look of a thing, as opp. to its reality, Lat. species, γνώμην ἐξαπατῶσʼ ἰδέαι outward appearances cheat the mind, Theogn.

a kind, sort, nature, Hdt.; ἐφρόνεον διφασίας ἰδέας they conceived two modes of acting, Hdt.; τὰ ὄργιʼ ἐστὶ τίνʼ ἰδέαν ἔχοντα; what is their nature or fashion? Eur.; καινὰς ἰδέας εἰσφέρειν to bring in new fashions, Ar.; πᾶσα ἰδέα θανάτου every form of death, Thuc.
in Logic, = εἶδος, a class, kind, sort, species, Plat.

div1.head: ἰδέ
div1.sense: and, Hom., Soph.

div1.head: ἰδέ
div1.sense: lo, behold, Hom.: later ἴδε.

div1.head: Ἴδη
div1.sense: Ida, i. e. the wooded hill, Mt. Ida, Il.; Epic gen., Ἴδηθεν μεδέων ruler of Ida, Il.; as adv. from Ida, Il.

div1.head: ἴδη
div1.sense: a timber-tree, in pl., Hdt.:—in sg., a wood, ἐν τῇ ἴδῃ τῇ πλείστῃ in the thick of the wood, Hdt.
as prop. n.,

div1.head: ἰδιοβουλέω
div1.sense: to follow oneʼs own counsel, take oneʼs own way, Hdt.

div1.head: ἰδιογνώμων
div1.sense: holding oneʼs own opinion, Arist.

div1.head: ἰδιόμορφος
div1.sense: of peculiar form, Plut.

div1.head: ἰδιόομαι
div1.sense: Mid. to appropriate to oneself, Plat.

div1.head: ἴδιος
div1.sense: oneʼs own, pertaining to oneself: and so,

private, personal, πρῆξις ἥδʼ ἰδίη οὐ δήμιος this business is private, not public, Od.; ἴδιος ἐν κοινῷ σταλείς embarking a private man in a public cause, Pind.; πλοῦτος ἴδιος καὶ δημόσιος private and public wealth, Thuc.; τὰ ἱρὰ καὶ τὸ ἴδια temples and private buildings, Hdt.

τὰ ἴδια, either private affairs, private interests, Thuc.; or oneʼs own property, Thuc.; ἴδια πράττειν to mind oneʼs own affairs, Eur.; τὰ ἐμὰ ἴδια Dem.:—in sg., τὸ ἡμέτερον ἴδιον Dem.; εἰς τὸ ἴδιον for oneself, Xen.; τοὐμὸν ἴδιον for my own part, Luc.
peculiar, separate, distinct, ἔθνος ἴδιον Hdt.; ἴδιοί τινες θεοί Ar.; ἴδιον ἢ ἄλλοι peculiar and different from others, Plat.; strange, unaccustomed, ἰδίοισιν ὑμεναίοισι Eur.
regul. comp. is ἰδιώτερος.; Sup. ἰδιώτατος, Dem.; later ἰδιαίτερος, -αίτατος, Arist.
adv. ἰδίως, especially, peculiarly, Plat., etc.
also ἰδίᾳ, Ionic -ίῃ, as adv. by oneself, privately, separately, on oneʼs own account, Hdt., etc.; οὔτε ἰδίᾳ οὔτε ἐν κοινῷ Thuc.; καὶ ἰδίᾳ καὶ δημοσίᾳ Thuc.:—c. gen. apart from, Ar.

div1.head: ἰδιόστολος
div1.sense: equipt at oneʼs own expense, Plut.; ἰδ. ἔπλευσε sailed in his own ship, Plut.

div1.head: ἰδιότης
div1.sense: peculiar nature, property, Xen.

div1.head: ἰδίω
div1.sense: to sweat, Od., Ar.

div1.head: ἰδίωσις
div1.sense: distinction between, Plat.

div1.head: ἰδιωτεία
div1.sense: private life or business, Xen., Plat.
uncouthness, want of education, Luc.

div1.head: ἰδιωτεύω
div1.sense: to be a private person, i. e. to live in retirement, Plat., Xen.:—of a country, to be of no consideration, Xen.
to practise privately, of a physician, Plat.
c. gen. rei, to be unpractised in a thing, Plat.

div1.head: ἰδιώτης
div1.sense: a private person, an individual, ξυμφέροντα καὶ πόλεσι καὶ ἰδιώταις Thuc., etc.
one in a private station, opp. to one taking part in public affairs, Hdt., Attic; opp. to στρατηγός, a private soldier, Xen.
a common man, plebeian, Plut.
as adj., ἰδ. βίος a private station, homely way of life, Plat.
one who has no professional knowledge, as we say "a layman," ἰατρὸς καὶ ἰδιώτης Thuc.; opp. to ποιητής, a prose-writer, Plat.; to a trained soldier, Thuc.; to a skilled workman, Plat.
c. gen. rei, unpractised, unskilled in a thing, Lat. expers, rudis, ἰατρικῆς Plat.; also, ἰδ. κατά τι Xen.
generally, a raw hand, an ignorant, ill-informed man, Xen., Dem.
ἰδιῶται oneʼs own countrymen, opp. to ξένοι, Ar.

div1.head: ἰδιωτικός
div1.sense: of or for a private person, private, Hdt., Attic
not done by rules of art, unprofessional, unskilful, rude, Plat.:—adv., ἰδιωτικῶς τὸ σῶμα ἔχειν, i. e. to neglect gymnastic exercises, Xen.

div1.head: ἰδμοσύνη
div1.sense: knowledge, skill, Hes.

div1.head: ἴδμων
div1.sense: skilled, skilful, τινός in a thing, Anth.

div1.head: ἰδνόομαι
div1.sense: to bend oneself, double oneself up, shrink up, esp. for pain, Il.; ἰδνωθεὶς ὀπίσω bent back, of one throwing up a ball, Hom.

div1.head: Ἰδομενεύς
div1.sense: the chief of the Cretans, properly strength of Ida (in Crete), Il.

div1.head: ἶδος
div1.sense: violent heat, as of the dog-days, Hes.

div1.head: ἰδού
div1.etym: 2nd sg mid imperat of εἰδόμην, as adv.
div1.sense: lo! behold! see there! Soph.; ἰδού, δέχου there! take it! Lat. en tibi! Soph., etc.:— well, as you please! Ar.
in repeating anotherʼs words quizzingly, ἰδού γʼ ἄκρατον oh yes, wine, Ar.

div1.head: ἰδρεία
div1.sense: skill, ἰδρείῃ πολέμοιο Il.

div1.head: ἴδρις
div1.sense: experienced, knowing, skilful, Od.; c. gen. rei, Hes., Trag., etc.; c. inf. knowing how to do, Od.
ἴδρις alone, the provident one, i. e. the ant, Hes.

div1.head: ἱδρόω
div1.etym: This Verb, like its oppos. ῥιγόω, is contracted Epic into ω and ωι instead of ου and οι, part. fem. ἱδρῶσα Il., lengthd. ἱδρώουσα, masc. acc. ἱδρώοντα, -οντας; but in Xen. we find ἱδροῦντι, not ἱδρῶντι.
div1.sense: to sweat, perspire, Hom. (esp. in Il.); ἵππους ὑπὸ ζυγοῦ ἱδρώοντας Od.; ἱδρώσει τελαμών it shall reek with sweat, Il.; c. acc. cogn., ἱδρῶθʼ ὃν ἵδρωσα Il.

div1.head: ἵδρυμα
div1.sense: a thing founded or built, a foundation, Plut.
like ἕδος, a temple, shrine, Hdt., Aesch., Eur.
τὸ ἵδρυμα πόλεως the stay, support of thy city, Lat. columen rei, Eur.

div1.head: ἵδρυσις
div1.sense: a founding, building, of temples, Plat.
Ἑρμέω ἱδρύσιες his statues, Anth.

div1.head: ἱδρυτέος
div1.sense: one must inaugurate a statue, Ar.
pass., ἱδρυτέον one must sit idle, Soph.

div1.head: ἱδρύω
div1.sense: to make to sit down, to seat, Hom., etc.; αὐτός τε κάθησο καὶ ἄλλους ἵδρυε λαούς Il.; ἵδρυσε τὴν στρατιήν encamped the army, Hdt.:—Pass. to be seated, sit. still, Il., Eur.; of an army, to lie encamped, Hdt.; ἀσφαλῶς ἱδρυμένος seated, steady, secure, Hdt.
like Lat. figere, to fix or settle persons in a place, εἰς δόμον Eur.:—Pass. to be settled, Hdt., Soph., etc.
in Mid. to establish, ἱδρ. τινὰ ἄνακτα Eur.; τινὰ ἐς οἶκόν Eur.
perf. pass. ἵδρῡμαι, of places, to be situated, to lie, Hdt.
to set up, found, esp. to dedicate temples, statues, Eur., Ar.:—Pass., ἱρόν, βωμὸς ἵδρυται Hdt.:—Mid. to set up for oneself, to found, Hdt., Eur.; perf. pass. in mid. sense, Hdt., Plat.

div1.head: ἱδρώς
div1.sense: sweat, Lat. sudor, Hom., Attic
the exudation of trees, gum, σμύρνης Eur.

div1.head: ἰδυῖα
div1.etym: Epic for εἰδυῖα, part. fem. of οἶδα
div1.sense: as adj., ἰδυίῃσι πραπίδεσσιν with knowing, skilful mind, Il.

div1.head: ἱέραξ
div1.sense: a hawk, falcon, Il., Ar.

div1.head: ἱεράομαι
div1.sense: Pass. to be a priest or priestess, Hdt., Thuc.

div1.head: ἱερατεία
div1.sense: the priestʼs office, priesthood, Arist., NTest.

div1.head: ἱεράτευμα
div1.sense: a priesthood, NTest.

div1.head: ἱερατευματικός
div1.sense: priestly, Plut.

div1.head: ἱερατεύω
div1.sense: to be a priest, NTest.

div1.head: ἱερατικός
div1.sense: of or for the priestʼs office, priestly, Arist., Plut.
devoted to sacred purposes, Luc.

div1.head: ἱέρεια
div1.sense: a priestess, Il., Attic

div1.head: ἱερεῖον
div1.sense: a victim, an animal for sacrifice or slaughter, Hom., Hdt., Attic
an offering for the dead, Od.
of cattle slaughtered for food, mostly in pl., Hdt., Xen.

div1.head: ἱερεύς
div1.sense: a priest, sacrificer, Il., etc.
metaph., ἱερεύς τις ἄτης a minister of woe, Aesch.; and, comically, λεπτοτάτων λήρων ἱερεῦ Ar.

div1.head: ἱερεύω
div1.sense: to slaughter for sacrifice, to sacrifice, Hom.
to slaughter for a feast, Od.: Mid. to slaughter for oneself, Od.

div1.head: ἱερογλυφικός
div1.sense: hieroglyphic; ἱερογλυφικά (sc. γράμματα) , τά, a way of writing on monuments used by the Egyptian priests, Luc.

div1.head: ἱερόγλωσσος
div1.sense: of prophetic tongue, Anth.

div1.head: ἱερογραμματεύς
div1.sense: a sacred scribe, a lower order of the Egyptian priesthood, Luc.

div1.head: ἱερόθυτος
div1.sense: offered to a god, ἱερ. καπνός smoke from the sacrifices, Ar.

div1.head: ἱεροκῆρυξ
div1.sense: the herald at a sacrifice, Dem.

div1.head: ἱερολογία
div1.sense: sacred or mystical language, Luc.

div1.head: ἱερομηνία
div1.sense: the holy time of the month, during which the great festivals were held and hostilities suspended, ἱερ. Νεμέας, of the Nemean games, Pind., Thuc.

div1.head: ἱερομήνια
div1.sense: the holy time of the month, of the Carneian festival at Sparta, Thuc.

div1.head: ἱερομνημονέω
div1.sense: to be ἱερομνήμων, Ar.

div1.head: ἱερομνήμων
div1.sense: the sacred Secretary or Recorder sent by each Amphictyonic state to their Council, Dem.:—generally, a recorder, notary, Arist.

div1.head: ἱερονίκης
div1.sense: conqueror in the games, Luc.

div1.head: ἱεροποιέω
div1.sense: to offer sacrifices, to sacrifice, Dem.

div1.head: ἱεροποιός
div1.sense: managing sacred rites: at Athens, the ἱεροποιοί were ten magistrates, one from each tribe, who saw that the victims were perfect, Plat., Dem.

div1.head: ἱεροπρεπής
div1.sense: beseeming a sacred place, person or matter, holy, reverend, Plat., Luc.; ἱεροπρεπέστατος Xen.

div1.head: ἱεροργίη
div1.etym: a false form for ἱρουργίη in Hdt.

div1.head: ἱερός
div1.sense: super-human, mighty, divine, wonderful, Hom.; often like θεσπέσιος, to express wonder or admiration, ἱερὸν τέλος, ἱερὸς στρατός a glorious band, Hom.; ἱερὸς δίφρος a splendid chariot, Il.; οὐχ ἱερόν no mighty matter! Theocr.

holy, hallowed, Lat. sacer, Hom., etc.; ἱερὸς πόλεμος a holy war, Ar., etc.: ἱρὰ γράμματα, ἱερογλυφικά, Hdt.; ἱερὸν τὸ σῶμα διδόναι, of one dedicated to a god, Eur.; ἱερὸς νόμος the law of sacrifice, Dem.; of the Roman Tribunes, to express sacrosanctus, Plut.; for ἱερὰ καὶ ὅσια, v. ὅσιος.
of kings, heroes, etc., from a notion of "the divinity that doth hedge a king,"Pind., Soph.
as Subst.,

ἱερά, Ionic ἱρά, τά, offerings, sacrifices, victims, ἱερὰ ῥέζειν, Lat. sacra facere, operari, Il.; ἔρδειν Hes.; θῦσαι Hdt.:—after Hom. the inwards of the victim, the auspices, τὰ ἱερὰ καλὰ ἦν Xen.; or, simply, τὰ ἱερὰ γίγνεται Xen.:—generally, sacred things or rites, Lat. sacra, Hdt.
ἱερόν, Ionic ἱρόν, τό, a temple, holy place, Hdt., Attic
ἱρὸν τῆς δίκης a sacred principle of right, Eur.
special phrases:
ἱερὸς λόχος, v. λόχος 1. 4.
ἱερὰ νόσος the awful disease, epilepsy, Hdt.
ἡ ἱ. ὁδός the sacred road to Delphi, Hdt.
ἡ ἱερά (sc. τριήρης) , of the Delian ship, or one of the state-ships (Salaminia or Paralos), Dem.
Ἱερὰ νῆσος, one of the Liparean group, Thuc.
adv. -ρῶς, holily, Plut.

div1.head: ἱεροσυλέω
div1.sense: to rob a temple, commit sacrilege, Ar., Plat.:—c. acc., ἱερ. τὰ ὅπλα to steal the sacred arms, Dem.

div1.head: ἱεροσυλία
div1.sense: temple-robbery, sacrilege, Xen., Plat.

div1.head: ἱερόσυλος
div1.sense: a temple-robber, sacrilegious person, Lat. sacrilegus, Ar., Plat.

div1.head: ἱερουργέω
div1.sense: to perform sacred rites: c. acc., ἱερ. τὸ εὐαγγέλιον to minister the gospel, NTest.; so in Mid., ἱερουργίας ἱερουργεῖσθαι Plut.

div1.head: ἱερουργία
div1.sense: religious service, worship, sacrifice, Hdt.

div1.head: ἱεροφαντέω
div1.sense: to be a hierophant, Luc.

div1.head: ἱεροφάντης
div1.sense: a hierophant, one who teaches the rites of sacrifice and worship, Hdt., Plut.:—at Rome, the Pontifex Maximus, Plut.

div1.head: ἱεροφαντία
div1.sense: the office of hierophant, Plut.

div1.head: ἱεροφαντικός
div1.sense: of a hierophant, Luc.; βίβλοι ἱερ. the libri pontificales, Plut. adv. -κῶς, Luc.

div1.head: ἱεροφύλαξ
div1.sense: a keeper of a temple, temple-warden, Lat. aedituus, Eur.

div1.head: ἱερόχθων
div1.sense: of hallowed soil, Anth.

div1.head: ἱερόω
div1.sense: to hallow, consecrate, dedicate, Plat.:—perf. pass. inf. ἱερῶσθαι Thuc.

div1.head: ἱερωσύνη
div1.sense: the office of priest, priesthood, Hdt., Attic

div1.head: ἰεῦ
div1.sense: an ironical exclamation, whew! Lat. hui! Ar.

div1.head: ἱζάνω
div1.sense: Causal, to make to sit, Il.
intr. to sit, Lat. sedere, Od.; ἐπʼ ὄμμασι ὕπνος ἱζάνει Il.
of soil, to settle down, sink in, Thuc.

div1.head: ἵζω
div1.sense: Causal, to make to sit, seat, place, μή μʼ ἐς θρόνον ἷζε Il.; ἵζει μάντιν ἐν θρόνοις Aesch.:—the Ionic and poet. aor1 εἷσα is always causal (as in the compds. ἐφ-, καθ-εῖσα) , εἷσεν ἐν κλισμοῖς, κατὰ κλισμούς, ἐπὶ θρόνου, ἐς δίφρον Hom.; εἷσέ μʼ ἐπὶ βουσί set me over the oxen, Od.; σκοπὸν εἷσε set as a spy, Il.; λόχον εἷσαν laid an ambush, Il.; εἷσεν ἐν Σχερίηι settled [them] in Scheria, Od.; imperat. εἷσον Od.; part. ἕσας Od.; so in Hdt., τοῦτον εἷσε ἐς τὸν θρόνον Hdt.; ἐπὶ τὸ δεῖπνον ἵζειν τοὺς βασιλέας Hdt.; inf. ἕσσαι in Pind.; rare in Attic, σὺ γάρ νιν εἷσας ἐς τόδε for thou didst bring it to this, Soph.; cf. καθίζω.
the aor1 mid. εἱσάμην is used in the sense of ἱδρύω, to dedicate temples statues, etc., to gods, Theogn., Hdt.; part. εἱσάμενος Thuc.
intr. to sit, sit down, Lat. sedere, Il.; ἵζειν ἐς θρόνον Od.; ἐς θᾶκον Soph.; also, ἐπὶ θρόνου Hom.; ἐπὶ τὸ δεῖπνον Hdt.; ἐπὶ κώπην, of rowers, Ar.:—c. acc. loci, ἵζειν θρόνον Aesch.; βωμόν Eur.
to sit still, be quiet, Hhymn.

Pass. also in signf. II, to sit, πάροιθʼ ἵζευ ἐμεῖο sit down before me, Il.: to lie in ambush, Il.: of an army, to sit down, take up a position, ἵζεσθαι ἀντίοι τινί Hdt.; ἵζεσθαι ἐν τῶι Τηυγέτωι or ἐς τὸ Τηύγετον Hdt.

div1.head: ἰήϊος
div1.sense: invoked with the cry ἰή, of Apollo, Aesch., etc.
mournful, grievous, Soph.; ἰήιος βοά a cry of mourning, Eur.

div1.head: ἵημι
div1.sense: to set a going, put in motion, being the Causal of εἶμι (ibo), ἧκα πόδας καὶ χεῖρε φέρεσθαι Od.; ἱ. πόδα Eur.: hence
to send, Hom., etc.

of sounds, to send forth, utter, Hom., etc.; Ἑλλάδα γλῶσσαν ἱ. to speak Greek, Hdt.; φωνὴν Παρνησίδα Aesch.; τὸ τᾶς εὐφήμου στόμα φροντίδος ἱέντες, i. e. speaking not in words, but in silent thought, Soph.
to send forth, throw, hurl, of stones or javelins, Hom.; c. gen. pers. to throw or shoot at one, Il.
like βάλλειν, c. dat. instrumenti, ἵησι τῆι ἀξίνηι he throws [at him] with his axe, Xen.
the acc. is often omitted, so that ἵημι sometimes seems intr., to throw, shoot, Hom.; c. gen. objecti, τῶν μεγάλων ψυχῶν ἱείς shooting at great souls, Soph.
of water, to let flow, let burst or spout forth, Il., Aesch., etc.; ὕδωρ omitted, ποταμὸς ἐπὶ γαῖαν ἵησιν the river pours over the land, Od.; so, of fire, Eur.
to let fall, κὰδ δὲ κάρητος ἧκε κόμας made his locks flow down from his head. Od.; ἐκ δὲ ποδοῖιν ἄκμονας ἧκα δύω I let two anvils hang from his two legs, Od.; ἧκαν ἑαυτούς let themselves go, Xen.
Mid. to send oneself, hasten, οἴκαδε ἱέμενος hastening homewards, Hom.; ἱέμενος Τροίηνδε Od.; so, δρόμωι ἵεσθαι ἐπί τινα Hdt.; etc.
metaph. to be set upon doing a thing, to desire to do it, c. inf., ἵετο γὰρ βαλέειν Il.:—c. gen. to long for, ἱέμενοι νίκης Il.:—absol. in part., ἱέμενός περ eager though he was, Od.

the 3rd pl. aor2 mid. ἕντο is used by Hom. in the phrase ἐπεὶ πόσιος καὶ ἐδητύος ἐξ ἔρον ἕντο, when they had put away the desire of meat and drink, i. e. eaten and drunk enough, Virgilʼs postquam exempta fames epulis.

div1.head: Ἰηπαιήων
div1.sense: epith. of Apollo, from the cry ἰὴ παιάν, Hhymn.
a hymn sung to him, Hhymn.

div1.head: ἰηπαιωνίζω
div1.sense: fut. ίσω, to cry ἰὴ παιών. Ar.

div1.head: ἰή
div1.sense: Lat. io! exclam. of joy, ἰή, ἰή, ἰή, Ar.; ἰὴ παιών Ar.
of grief, Aesch.

div1.head: Ἰησοῦς
div1.sense: Jesus, Greek form of Hebrew Joshua or Jehoshua, Saviour, NTest.

div1.head: ἰθαγενής
div1.sense: born in lawful wedlock, legitimate, ἀλλά με ἶσον ἰθαιγενέεσσιν ἐτίμα honoured me like his true-born sons, Od.:—so, of a nation, from the ancient stock, genuine, ἰθ. Αἰγύπτιοι Hdt.; of some mouths of the Nile, natural, original, opp. to ὀρυκτά, Hdt.

div1.head: Ἰθάκηνδε
div1.sense: to Ithaca, Od.

div1.head: Ἰθάκη
div1.sense: Ithaca, the home of Ulysses, an island on the West coast of Greece, Hom.:—hence he is called Ἰθακήσιος.

div1.head: Ἰθακήσιος
div1.sense: Ithacan, Hom.

div1.head: ἴθμα
div1.sense: a step, motion, Il.

div1.head: ἰθυδίκης
div1.sense: giving right judgment, Hes.

div1.head: ἰθυδρόμος
div1.sense: straight-running, Anth.

div1.head: ἰθύθριξ
div1.sense: straight-haired, opp. to οὐλόθριξ (wooly-haired), Hdt.

div1.head: ἰθυμαχία
div1.sense: a fair, stand-up fight, Hdt.

div1.head: ἰθυμάχος
div1.sense: fighting fairly, Simon.

div1.head: ἰθύντατα
div1.etym: adverb Sup. of ἰθύ: v. ἰθύς I. 2.

div1.head: ἰθυντήρ
div1.sense: a guide, pilot, Anth.

div1.head: ἰθύνω
div1.sense: Ionic for εὐθύνω, to make straight, straighten, ἐπὶ στάθμην ἴθυνεν by the rule, Od.:—Pass. to run evenly, of horses yoked abreast, Il.

to guide in a straight line, ἵππους ἰθύνομεν (Epic for -ωμεν) let us drive them straight, Il.; νῆα ἰθύνει the pilot] keeps it straight, Il.; βέλος ἴθυνεν she sped it straight, Il.:—Mid. to guide or steer for oneself, ἰθύνετο ὀϊστόν aimed his arrow straight, Od.; πηδαλίωι ἰθύνετο (sc. νῆα) Od.; c. gen., ἀλλήλων ἰθυνομένων δοῦρα as they drove their spears straight at each other, Il.:—Pass., of a boat, to be guided, steered, Hdt.

to guide, direct, rule, Il., Aesch.: of a judge, μύθους ἰθύνειν to rectify unjust judgments, Hes.; ἰθ. τὸ πλέον τινί to adjudge the greater part to him, Theocr.:—Pass., ἰθύνεσθαι θανάτωι to be punished with death, Hdt.

div1.head: ἰθυπόρος
div1.sense: going straight on, Anth.

div1.head: ἰθυπτίων
div1.sense: straight-flying, of a javelin, Il.

div1.head: ἰθύς
div1.sense: of motion, straight, direct, Lat. rectus, used by Hom. in this sense only in adv. ἰθύς (infr. II); ἰθείῃ τέχνῃ straightway, forthwith, Hdt.; ἰθεῖαν (sc. ὁδόν) straight on, Lat. recta (sc. via), Hdt.; ἐκ τῆς ἰθείης (sc. ὁδοῦ) outright, openly, Hdt.; κατʼ ἰθὺ εἶναι to be right over against, opposite, Hdt.

in moral sense, straight, straight-forward, just, ἰθεῖα γὰρ ἔσται ἡ δίκη Il.; ἰθείῃσι δίκαις Hes.: so in Sup. adv., δίκην ἰθύντατα εἰπεῖν to give judgment most fairly, Il.; so, πρήξιες ἰθύτεραι [ῠ] Theogn.; ἰθύς τε καὶ δίκαιος Hdt.

ἰθύς, or less commonly ἰθύ, as adv., straight at, right at, c. gen. objecti, ἰθὺς Δαναῶν Il.; ἰθὺς κίεν οἴκου went straight towards the home, Il.; ἰθὺ τοῦ Ἴστρου Hdt.;—also, ἰθὺς πρὸς τεῖχος Il.; ἰθὺς ἐπὶ Θεσσαλίης Hdt.

absol., ἰθὺς φρονέων resolving to go straight on, Il.; ἰθὺς μαχέσασθαι to fight hand to hand, Il.; τέτραπτο πρὸς ἰθύ οἱ, i. e. προσετέτραπτό οἱ ἰθύ, he fronted him face to face, Il.:—of Time, straightway, Hdt.
ἰθέως, regul. adv., Hdt.

div1.head: ἰθύς2
div1.sense: a straight course, ἀνʼ ἰθύν straight upwards, on high, Hom.
a direct attempt, purpose, πᾶσαν ἐπʼ ἰθύν Hom.; γυναικῶν γνώομεν ἰθύν Od.

div1.head: ἰθυτενής
div1.sense: stretched out, straight, Anth.: upright, perpendicular, Anth.

div1.head: ἰθύφαλλος
div1.sense: the phallos carried in the festivals of Bacchus: metaph. a lewd fellow, Dem.

div1.head: ἰθύω
div1.sense: to go straight, press right on, Il.; ἴθυσε μάχη πεδίοιο the tide of war set straight over the plain, Il.:—c. gen. objecti, ἴθυσε νεός made straight for the ship, Il.; ἴθυσαν δʼ ἐπὶ τεῖχος Il.; ἴθυσαν πρός . . Hdt.
c. inf. to strive or struggle to do, Od.; ὅκη ἰθύσειε στρατεύεσθαι whichever way he purposed to march, Hdt.

div1.head: ἱκανός
div1.sense: becoming, befitting, sufficing:

of persons, sufficient, competent, c. inf., Hdt.; ἱκ. τεκμηριῶσαι sufficient to prove a point, Thuc.; ἱκ. ζημιοῦν with sufficient power to punish, Xen.; c. acc. rei, ἀνὴρ γνώμην ἱκανός a man of sufficient prudence, Hdt.; ἱκ. τὴν ἰατρικήν sufficiently versed in medicine, Xen.:—c. dat. pers. a match for, equivalent to, εἷς πολλοῖς ἱκανός Plat.:—absol., ἱκανὸς Ἀπόλλων Soph.; ἱκ. ἂν γένοιο σύ Eur.; ἱκανοὶ ὡς πρὸς ἰδιώτας very tolerable in comparison with common men, Plat.

of things, sufficient, adequate, enough, Eur.; ἱκανὰ τοῖς πολεμίοις εὐτύχηται they have had successes enough, Thuc.:—of size, large enough, οὐχ ἱκανῆς οὔσης τῆς Ἀττικῆς Thuc.; ἱκανά σοι μέλαθρα ἐγκαθυβρίζειν large enough to riot in, Eur.:—of Time, considerable, long, Ar.
sufficient, satisfactory, ἱκανὴ μαρτυρία Plat.:— τὸ ἱκανὸν λαμβάνειν to take security, NTest.
adv. -νῶς, sufficiently, adequately, enough, Thuc., etc.
ἱκ. ἔχειν to be sufficient, to be far enough advanced, Thuc., Xen., etc.: —Sup. ἱκανώτατα Plat.

div1.head: ἱκανότης
div1.sense: sufficiency, fitness, Plat.
a sufficiency, sufficient supply, Plat.

div1.head: ἱκανόω
div1.sense: to make sufficient, qualify, NTest.

div1.head: ἱκάνω
div1.etym: tense other than present and imperfect are supplied by ἱκνέομαι
div1.sense: to come, arrive, Hom., Aesch.: c. acc. to come to, reach, ἱκάνω νῆας Ἀχαιῶν Il., etc.; of a tall tree, διʼ ἠέρος αἰθέρʼ ἵκανεν Il.; ἥβης μέτρον ἱκ. reached, attained to the age of youth, Od.

with a person for the object, often of grief, hardship, and the like, ἄχος κραδίην καὶ θυμὸν ἱκάνει Il.; so, ἄλγος, γῆρας, κάματος, χόλος ἱκάνει τινά Hom.; παλαίφατα θέσφατʼ ἱκάνει με they are fulfilled upon me, Od.
of a suppliant, σὰ γούνατʼ ἱκάνω Il.; cf. ἱκνέομαι ΙΙΙ.
also in Mid., χρειὼ γὰρ ἱκάνεται Il.; τὰ σὰ γούναθʼ ἱκάνομαι Hom.

div1.head: Ἰκάριος
div1.sense: Icarian, πόντος Ἰκ. the Aegean between the Cyclades and Caria, where Icarus son of Daedalus was drowned, Il.; Ἰκ. πέλαγος Hdt.

div1.head: ἴκελος
div1.etym: poet. and Ionic form of εἴκελος,
div1.sense: like, resembling, τινι Il., Hdt., Pind.

div1.head: ἰκελόω
div1.sense: to make like, Anth.

div1.head: ἱκεσία
div1.sense: the prayer of a suppliant, Eur.; ἱκεσίαισι σαῖς at thy entreaties, Eur.

div1.head: ἱκέσιος
div1.sense: = ἱκετήσιος, Trag.
of or consisting of suppliants, Aesch.
suppliant, of prayers, Soph., Eur.; of persons, Soph., Eur.

div1.head: ἱκετεία
div1.sense: supplication, Thuc.; ἱκετείαν ποιεῖσθαί τινος to supplicate him, Thuc.

div1.head: ἱκέτευμα
div1.sense: a mode of supplication, Thuc.

div1.head: ἱκετευτέος
div1.sense: to be besought or entreated, Luc.

div1.head: ἱκετεύω
div1.sense: to approach as a suppliant, ἐπεί σε ἱκέτευσα Od.; ἐς Πηλῆʼ ἱκέτευσε Il.; ἱκ. τινὰ γονάτων or πρὸς γονάτων Eur.
to supplicate, beseech one to do a thing, c. acc. et inf., Od., Hdt., Attic:—also c. gen. pers. et inf. to beg of one that . . , Eur.
c. acc. rei, to ask a thing as a suppliant, Eur., Thuc.

div1.head: ἱκετήριος
div1.sense: of or fit for suppliants, ἱκτ. θησαυρός, of hair offered to a god, Soph.; ἱκτήριοι ἱκέται, Soph.

ἱκετηρία, Ionic -ίη, (sub. ῥάβδος) , an olive-branch which the suppliant held as a symbol of his condition, Hdt., Ar., etc.; so, κλάδοι ἱκτήριοι Soph.:—metaph., ἱκετηρίαν δὲ γόνασιν ἐξάπτω σέθεν τὸ σῶμα τοὐμόν I attach my body to thy knees as a suppliant olive-branch, Eur.; so, νομίζετε τὸν παῖδα ἱκτηρίαν προκεῖσθαι Dem.

div1.head: ἱκετήσιος
div1.sense: epith. of Zeus, as tutelary god of suppliants, Od.

div1.head: ἱκέτης
div1.sense: one who comes to seek protection, a suppliant or fugitive, who lays his ἱκετηρία on the altar or hearth, after which his person was inviolable; esp. one who seeks purification after homicide, Hom., etc.

div1.head: ἱκέτις
div1.etym: fem. of ἱκέτης, Hdt., Soph., etc.

div1.head: ἰκμάς
div1.sense: moisture, juice, Il., Hdt.:—comic metaph., τὴν ἰκμάδα τῆς φροντίδος Ar.; ἰ. Βακχου, i. e. wine, Anth.; ἰ. δρυός, i. e. gum, Anth.

div1.head: ἴκμενος
div1.sense: only in the phrase ἴκμενος οὖρος (from ἴκω, ἱκνέομαι) a following, favourable wind, Hom.

div1.head: ἱκνέομαι
div1.sense: to come to a place, c. acc. loci, or foll. by a prep., ἵκετο νῆας or ἐπὶ νῆας Hom., etc.

to come to, ἵκετο χρόα, of a spear, Il.; τέλος ἵκεο μύθων Il.; ἠῶ ἱκέσθαι, i. e. to live till morning, Od.; λέκτροιο θεσμὸν ἱκ., i. e. to wed, Od.; ὅ τι χεῖρας ἵκοιτο, whatever came to hand, Od.; ἱκ. ἐς λόγους τινός to speak with one, Soph., etc.
of suffering, sorrow, etc., to come upon, πένθος ἱκ. τινά Il.; ἄχος, χόλος τινὰ ἱκ. θυμόν or κραδίην Hom.

to approach as suppliant, Hom.; τὰ σὰ γοῦνα ἱκόμεθʼ Od.:—hence, like ἱκετεύω, to supplicate, beseech, τὰς θεὰς ἱκνοῦμαι Soph.; καί σε πρὸς θεῶν ἱκνοῦμαι Soph.:—c. inf., πάντες σʼ ἱκνοῦνται θάψαι νεκρούς Eur.

impers. like προσήκει, it becomes, befits, φαμὲν ἡμέας ἱκνέεσθαι ἡγεμονεύειν we say that it befits us to take the lead, Hdt.; τοὺς μάλιστα ἱκνέεται (sc. κεκάρθαι) whom it most concerns, Hdt.; so, ἐς τὸν ἱκνέεται he to whom it belongs, Hdt.

in part., τὸ ἱκνεύμενον that which is fitting, proper, Hdt.; ὁ ἱκν. χρόνος the fit, proper time, Hdt.; τὸ ἱκν. ἀνάλωμα the proportionate expense, Thuc.:—hence adv. ἱκνευμένως, fittingly, aright, Hdt.part.

div1.head: ἴκρια
div1.sense: the half-decks fore and aft of Homeric ships, Hom.: the planks of the deck, Od.
generally, a platform, stage, Hdt.

div1.head: ἴκταρ
div1.sense: following closely, Hes.
of Place, close to, hard by, Aesch., Plat.; c. gen., Aesch.

div1.head: ἱκτήρ
div1.sense: a suppliant, Soph., Eur.
as adj. = ἱκετήριος, Aesch.

div1.head: ἰκτῖνος
div1.sense: a kite, Hdt., Ar., Plat.

div1.head: ἴκτις
div1.sense: the yellow-breasted marten, the marten-cat, (cf. γαλέη) , Lat. mustela, Ar.

div1.head: ἵκτωρ
div1.sense: as adj. suppliant, Eur.

div1.head: ἵκω
div1.sense: to come to, reach, c. acc. or with a prep., ἵκειν ἐς πατρίδα, ἵκειν κατὰ νῆας or ἵκειν δόμον, Τροίην, κλισίην Hom.
of sufferings, feelings, etc., ὅτε κέν τινα χόλος ἵκοι whenever anger come upon him, Il.; χρειὼ ἵκει με necessity is upon me, Od.

div1.head: ἰλαδόν
div1.sense: in troops, Lat. turmatim, Il., Hdt.: generally, in abundance, in a mass, Hes.

div1.head: ἵλαος
div1.sense: neut. ἵλεα:—of gods, propitious, gracious, Il., Hes., etc.
of men, gracious, kindly, gentle, θυμὸς ἐνὶ φρεσὶν ἵλαος ἔστω Il.; so in Soph.

div1.head: ἱλαρός
div1.sense: cheerful, gay, merry, joyous, Lat. hilaris, Ar., Xen.:— τὸ ἱλαρόν ἱλαρότης, Plut. adv. -ρῶς, Xen.

div1.head: ἱλαρότης
div1.sense: cheerfulness, Lat. hilaritas, Plut.

div1.head: ἱλάσκομαι
div1.sense: to appease, θεὸν ἱλάσκεσθαι to make him propitious to one, conciliate him, win his favour, Hom.; μολπῆι θεὸν ἱλάσκοντο Il.; ὄφρʼ ἡμῖν Ἑκάεργον ἱλάσσεαι Il.; so of men, Hdt., Plat.
in NTest. to expiate, τὰς ἁμαρτίας.
in NTest. also, an aor1 imperat. pass. ἱλάσθητι, be gracious.

div1.head: ἱλασμός
div1.sense: a means of appeasing, Plut.:— a propitiation, NTest.

div1.head: ἱλαστήριος
div1.sense: propitiatory,
(sub. ἐπίθεμα) as Subst., ἱλαστήριον, the mercy-seat, covering of the ark in the Holy of Holies, NTest.
(sub. ἀνάθημα) , a propitiation, NTest.

div1.head: ἱλήκω
div1.sense: to be gracious, εἴ κεν Ἀπόλλων ἡμῖν ἱλήκῃσι (Epic 3rd sg. subj.) Od.

div1.head: ἵλημι
div1.sense: in prayers, be gracious! Od.; Doric ἵλαθι Theocr.

div1.head: ἴλη
div1.sense: a crowd, band, troop of men, Hdt., Soph.: εὔφρονες ἶλαι merry companies, Pind.; also, ἴλη λεόντων Eur.
a troop of horse, Lat. turma, ala, κατʼ ἴλας ἰλαδόν, Xen.

div1.head: Ἰλιάδαι
div1.sense: descendants of Ilos, i. e. Trojans, Eur.

div1.head: Ἰλιακός
div1.sense: Ilian, Trojan, Anth.

div1.head: Ἰλιάς
div1.sense: fem. of Ἰλιακός, Hdt., Trag.
as Subst.: Troy, the Troad, Hdt.
(sub. γυνή) , a Trojan woman, Eur.
(sub. ποίησις) , the Iliad, Arist.; proverb., Ἰλιὰς κακῶν, i. e. an endless string of woes, Dem.

div1.head: ἰλιγγιάω
div1.sense: to be or become dizzy, lose oneʼs head, caused by looking down from a height or by drunkenness, Plat.; by fear, Ar., etc.

div1.head: ἴλιγγος
div1.sense: a spinning round: esp. a swimming in the head, Lat. vertigo, Plat.

div1.head: Ἰλιόθεν
div1.sense: from Troy, Hom.

div1.head: Ἰλιόθι
div1.sense: Ἰλ. πρό before Troy, Od., etc.

div1.head: Ἰλιορραίστης
div1.sense: destroyer of Troy, Anth.

div1.head: Ἴλιος
div1.sense: Ilian, Trojan, Eur.

div1.head: Ἴλιος
div1.sense: Ilios or Ilium, the city of Ilus, Troy, Hom., Eur.:— Ἴλιον, ου, τό, Il., Trag.; Ἰλιόφι, τείχεα the walls of Troy, Il.

div1.head: ἰλλάς
div1.sense: a rope, band, Il.

div1.head: ἰλυόεις
div1.sense: muddy, impure, Anth.

div1.head: ἰλύς
div1.sense: mud, slime, dirt, Il., Hdt.

div1.head: ἱμάντινος
div1.sense: of leathern thongs, Hdt.

div1.head: ἱμαντοπέδη
div1.sense: a leathern noose, of a polypusʼ leg, Anth.

div1.head: ἱμάσθλη
div1.sense: the thong of a whip, a whip, Hom.

div1.head: ἱμάς
div1.sense: a leathern strap or thong, Il.: in pl. the traces by which horses were attached to the chariot, Il.: also, the reins, Il., Soph., Eur.
the straps on which the body of the chariot was hung, Il.
the lash of a whip, Il.
the caestus of boxers, consisting of straps put round the hand, Il.
in sg. the magic girdle of Aphrodite, Lat. cestus, Il.
the chin-strap of the helmet, Il.
in Od. a latchet or thong, by which the bolt was shot home into the socket, and which was then fastened to the κορώνη, Od.
after Hom. the thong or latchet of a sandal, Xen.
a dog-leash, Xen.: proverb., ἱμὰς κύνειός ἐστι heʼs as tough as a dog- leash, Ar.

div1.head: ἱμάσσω
div1.sense: to flog horses, Hom.; generally, to scourge, smite, Il.

div1.head: ἱματιοκάπηλος
div1.sense: a clothes-seller, Luc.

div1.head: ἱμάτιον
div1.etym: in form a Dim. of ἷμα, i.e. εἷμα
div1.sense: an outer garment, a cloak or mantle worn above the χιτών, the same as Homerʼs χλαῖνα, Hdt., Ar.:—used of the Roman toga, ἐν ἱματίοις, Lat. togati, Plut.
ἱμάτια, τά, generally, clothes, Hdt., Dem.
generally, a cloth, Hdt.

div1.head: ἱματιοφυλακέω
div1.sense: to take care of clothes, Luc.

div1.head: ἱματισμός
div1.sense: clothing, apparel, Theophr.

div1.head: ἱμείρω
div1.sense: to long for, yearn after, desire a thing, c. gen., Od., Aesch., etc.:—c. inf. to long or wish to do, Solon, Aesch., etc.
as Dep. to desire, c. gen., ὁππότʼ ἂν ἧς ἱμείρεται αἴης (Epic for -ηται) Od.; χρημάτων ἱμ. μεγάλως Hdt.

div1.head: ἱμερόεις
div1.sense: exciting love or desire, lovely, delightsome, charming, Hom., Theocr.:—Sup. ἱμεροέστατος Theogn.

div1.head: ἱμεροθαλής
div1.sense: sweetly blooming, Anth.

div1.head: ἵμερος
div1.sense: a longing or yearning after a thing, Lat. desiderium, c. gen., Il.; γόου ἵμερον ὦρσεν raised [in them] a yearning after tears, i. e. a desire to weep, Il.; and with a second gen., πατρὸς ὑφʼ ἵμερον ὦρσε γόοιο for his father, Od.; ἵμερον ἔχειν ἱμείρεσθαι, Hdt.:—in pl., πολλοὶ ἵμεροι various emotions, Aesch.
absol. desire, love, Il., etc.
as adj., but only in neut. as adv., ἵμερον αὐλεῖν Anth.; ἵμερα μελίζεσθαι, δακρύειν Anth.

div1.head: ἱμερόφωνος
div1.sense: of lovely voice or song, Theocr.

div1.head: ἱμερτός
div1.sense: longed for, lovely, Il., Hes.

div1.head: ἱμονιά
div1.sense: the rope of a draw-well, Ar.

div1.head: ἱμονιοστρόφος
div1.sense: a water-drawer, Ar.

div1.head: ἵνα
div1.sense: Adverb,
of Place,
demonstr. in that place, there, only in Il. 10. 127.

relat., = ὅπου, in which place, where, Hdt., etc.;—so, ἵνα τε Il.; ἵνα περ Hom.:—c. gen., ἵνα γῆς in whatever part of the land, Hdt.; ἔμαθε ἵνα ἦν κακοῦ in what a calamity, Hdt.; οὐχ ὁρᾷς ἵνʼ εἶ κακοῦ Soph.
= ὅποι, with Verbs of motion, whither, Od.; ὁρᾷς ἵνʼ ἥκεις Soph.
of circumstance, when, at which, Od.
Final Conjunction, = ὅπως, that, in order that, Lat. ut, Hom.:
with subj.,
after principal tenses of ind., Hom., etc.
after historical tenses, in similes, where the aor. refers to any possible time, Od.
after opt. and ἄν, ἔδωκε μένος, ἵνα γένοιτο she gave him vigour, that he might become, Il.
with opt., after historical tenses, Hom., etc.
with past tenses of ind., to express a consequence which has not followed or cannot follow, ἵνʼ ἦν τυφλός in which case he must be blind, Soph., etc.
ἵνα μή as the negat. of ἵνα, that not, Lat. ut ne or ne, Il., Attic
elliptical usages,
where the purpose only is stated, Ζεὺς ἔσθʼ, ἵνʼ εἰδῇς ʼtis Zeus, [I tell thee this] that thou mayʼst know it, Soph.; so, ἵνα συντέμω Dem.
ὅρα or βλέπε being understood, ἵνα ἐλθὼν ἐπιθῇς τὰς χεῖρας αὐτῇ see that thou come and lay hands on her, NTest.
ἵνα τί (sc. γένηται) ; to what end? Ar., Plat.

div1.head: ἰνδάλλομαι
div1.etym: Dep., hardly used, save in pres. and imperf.
div1.sense: to appear like, look like, ἀθανάτοις ἰνδάλλεται εἰσοράασθαι he is like the immortals to look upon, Od.; ἰνδάλλετο δέ σφισι μεγαθύμῳ Πηλείωνι he seemed to them like the son of P., Il.
to appear, seem, Il.; ὥς μοι ἰνδάλλεται ἦτορ as my heart seems to me [to say], i. e. as the matter seems to me, Od.; ἰνδάλλεται ὁμοιότατος κλητῆρος he seems most like a summoner, Ar.

div1.head: ἴνδαλμα
div1.sense: an appearance, Lat. species, Anth., Luc.

div1.head: Ἰνδικός
div1.sense: Indian, Hdt., etc.

div1.head: Ἰνδολέτης
div1.sense: Indian-killer, Anth.

div1.head: Ἰνδός
div1.sense: an Indian, Hdt., etc.
the river Indus, Hdt.
as adj. = Ἰνδικός, Anth.

div1.head: ἰνίον
div1.sense: the muscle at the back of the neck, the nape of the neck, Il.

div1.head: ἶνις
div1.sense: a son, Aesch., Eur.:— ἶνις, ἡ, a daughter, Eur.

div1.head: ἰνώδης
div1.sense: fibrous, of parts of animals, Xen.

div1.head: Ἰνώ
div1.sense: Ino, daughter of Cadmus, worshipped as a sea-goddess by the name of Leucothea, Od., Hes.

div1.head: ἴξαλος
div1.sense: of the ibex bounding, springing, Il.

div1.head: ἰξευτής
div1.sense: a fowler, bird-catcher, Bion., Anth.
as adj. catching with birdlime, Anth.

div1.head: Ἰξίων
div1.sense: Ixion, a king of Thessaly: his name prob. was = ἱκέτης, for he was the first homicide, and therefore the first suppliant, Pind., Aesch.

div1.head: ἰξοβολέω
div1.sense: to catch with limed twigs: to catch, Anth.

div1.head: ἰξοεργός
div1.sense: one who uses birdlime, Anth.

div1.head: ἰξός
div1.sense: mistletoe, Lat. viscum, Arist.
birdlime prepared from the mistletoe berry, Eur.
metaph., ἐκφυγὼν τὸν ἰξὸν τὸν ἐν πράγματι Luc.

div1.head: ἰξοφορεύς
div1.sense: limed, Anth.

div1.head: ἰξύς
div1.sense: the waist, Od.

div1.head: Ἰόβακχος
div1.sense: Bacchus invoked with the cry of ἰώ, Anth.

div1.head: ἰοβλέφαρος
div1.sense: violet-eyed, Luc.

div1.head: ἰοβολέω
div1.sense: to shoot arrows, dart, Anth.

div1.head: ἰοβόλος
div1.sense: shooting arrows, Anth.
shedding venom, poisonous, Anth.

div1.head: ἰοβόστρυχος
div1.sense: dark-haired, Pind.

div1.head: ἰοδνεφής
div1.sense: violet-dark, purple, Od.

div1.head: ἰοδόκος
div1.sense: holding arrows, Hom.: —as Subst. a quiver, Anth.

div1.head: ἰοειδής
div1.sense: like the violet, purple, of the sea, Hom.

div1.head: ἰόεις
div1.sense: violet-coloured, dark, Il.

div1.head: ἰομιγής
div1.sense: mixed with poison, Anth.

div1.head: ἰονθάς
div1.sense: shaggy, epith. of the wild goat, Od.

div1.head: Ἰόνιος
div1.sense: of or called after Io, Ἰόνιος κόλπος or πόρος, the sea between Epirus and Italy, across which Io swam, Hdt., Aesch., etc.

div1.head: ἴον
div1.sense: the violet, Theocr.:—once in Hom., λειμῶνες ἴου ἠδὲ σελίνου θήλεον the meadows were blooming with ἴον and parsley;—but whether it is here violet or some other dark blue flower is doubtful.

div1.head: ἰόπλοκος
div1.sense: weaving violets, Anth.[cp. LSJ]

div1.head: ἰός
div1.sense: an arrow, Il., Trag.

div1.head: ἰός2
div1.sense: rust, Theogn., Plat.
poison, as of serpents, Trag.

div1.head: ἰοστέφανος
div1.sense: violet-crowned, Hhymn., Solon., etc.

div1.head: ἰότης
div1.sense: will, desire, θεῶν ἰότητι by the will or hest of the gods, Hom.
= ἕκατι II, for the sake of, ἰότᾱτι γάμων Aesch.

div1.head: Ἰουδαΐζω
div1.sense: to side with or imitate the Jews, NTest.

div1.head: Ἰουδαῖος
div1.sense: a Jew: Ἰουδαία, a Jewish woman; ἡ Ἰουδαία (sub. γῆ) , Judaea.

div1.head: ἴουλος
div1.sense: the young hair at the side of the face, the whiskers, Od., Aesch.

div1.head: ἰού
div1.sense: Interj.
a cry of woe, Lat. heu! Trag.
like ἰώ, a cry of surprise, ho! Aesch., Ar., etc.

div1.head: ἰοχέαιρα
div1.sense: arrow-pourer, shooter of arrows, of Artemis, Hom.
div1.etym: Prob. from χέω, not from χαίρω.

div1.head: -ί
div1.sense: -ί_, iota demonstrativum, in familiar Attic (not in Trag.), is attached to demonstr. Pronouns, to strengthen their force, as οὑτοσί αὑτηΐ τουτί, Lat. hicce; ἐκεινοσί ὁδί ταδί τοσουτονί τοσονδί τυννουτοσί, etc.; also to demonstr. Advs., as οὑτωσί ὡδί ἐνθαδί δευρί νυνί.

div1.head: ἰπνίτης
div1.sense: baked in the oven, Anth.

div1.head: ἰπνοποιός
div1.sense: one who works at an oven, Luc.

div1.head: ἰπνός
div1.sense: an oven or furnace, Hdt., Ar.
the place of the oven, i. e. the kitchen, Ar.
a lantern, Ar.

div1.head: ἰπόω
div1.sense: Pass. to be weighed down, Aesch., Ar.

div1.head: ἶπος
div1.sense: in a mouse-trap, the piece of wood that falls and catches the mouse: generally any weight, Pind.

div1.head: ἱππαγρέται
div1.sense: three officers at Lacedaemon, who chose 300 ἔφηβοι, to serve as a bodyguard for the kings, Xen.

div1.head: ἱππαγωγός
div1.sense: carrying horses, of ships used as cavalry transports, Hdt., Thuc., etc.

div1.head: ἱππάζομαι
div1.sense: to drive horses, drive a chariot, Il.: later, to ride, Hdt., Ar.
Pass., of the horse, to be ridden or driven, Plat.: to be broken in for riding, Xen.
ἱππάζεσθαι χώραν to ride over a country, Plut.

div1.head: ἱππαλεκτρυών
div1.sense: a horse-cock, gryphon, a fabulous animal, Aesch.

div1.head: ἱππαλίδας
div1.etym: poet. lengthd. form for ἱππεύς, Theocr.

div1.head: ἱππαπαί
div1.sense: a cry of the Ἱππεῖς, a parody of the boatmenʼs cry (ῥυππαπαί) , Ar.

div1.head: ἱππάριον
div1.sense: Dim. of ἵππος, a pony, Xen.

div1.head: ἱππαρμοστής
div1.sense: a commander of cavalry, Xen.

div1.head: ἱππαρχέω
div1.sense: to command the cavalry, c. gen., Hdt., Dem.

div1.head: ἱππαρχία
div1.sense: the office of ἵππαρχος, Xen.

div1.head: ἱππαρχικός
div1.sense: of or for a ἵππαρχος· ἱππαρχικόν ἐστι it is part of his duty, Xen.

div1.head: ἵππαρχος
div1.sense: a general of cavalry, Hdt.: at Athens there were two, with 10 φύλαρχοι under them, Ar.

div1.head: ἱππασία
div1.sense: riding, horse-exercise, Ar., Xen.
chariot-driving, Luc.

div1.head: ἱππάσιμος
div1.sense: fit for horses, fit for riding, Hdt., Xen.:—metaph., κόλαξιν ἱππάσιμος ridden by flatterers, Plut.

div1.head: ἱππάς
div1.sense: ἱππὰς στολή, a riding-dress, Hdt.

div1.head: ἱππαστής
div1.sense: = ἱππευτής, Luc.
as adj. fit for riding, of a horse, Xen.

div1.head: ἱππαστικός
div1.sense: fond of riding, Plut.

div1.head: ἱππάφεσις
div1.sense: the starting-post in a race, Anth.

div1.head: ἱππεία
div1.sense: a riding or driving of horses, horsemanship, Soph., Eur.
cavalry, Xen.

div1.head: ἵππειος
div1.sense: of a horse or horses, Hom., Soph.; ἵππ. λόφος a horse-hair crest, Il.

div1.head: ἵππερος
div1.sense: horse-love, horse-fever, Ar.

div1.head: ἵππευμα
div1.sense: a ride on horseback or journey in a chariot, Eur.

div1.head: ἱππεύς
div1.sense: a horseman, either of the charioteer or of the hero who fights from a chariot, Il.
a horseman, i. e. rider, first in Hdt.
in Solon.ʼs constitution, the ἱππεῖς, Attic ἱππῆς, Horsemen or Knights, were the 2d class, required to possess land producing 300 medimni, and a horse, Ar., Thuc.,
at Sparta 300 chosen men, the Kingʼs Body Guard, Hdt.

div1.head: ἱππευτής
div1.sense: a rider, horseman, Eur.

div1.head: ἱππεύω
div1.sense: to be a horseman or rider, to ride, Hdt., Attic:—so in Mid., Hdt.
metaph. of the wind, Eur.
to be a trooper, serve in the cavalry, Xen.
of a horse, as we say "the horse rides (i. e. carries his rider) well," Xen.

div1.head: ἱππηδόν
div1.sense: adv. like a horse, Aesch.
as on horseback, like a horseman, Ar.

div1.head: ἱππηλάσιος
div1.sense: ἱππ. ὁδός a chariot-road, Il.

div1.head: ἱππηλατέω
div1.sense: to ride or drive, Ar.

div1.head: ἱππηλάτης
div1.sense: a driver of horses, one who fights from a chariot, a Knight, Hom.

div1.head: ἱππήλατος
div1.sense: fit for horsemanship or driving, of countries, Od.

div1.head: ἱππημολγοί
div1.sense: the mare-milkers, a Scythian or Tartar tribe, Il.

div1.head: ἱππιάναξ
div1.sense: king of horsemen, Aesch.

div1.head: ἱππικός
div1.sense: of a horse or horses, Hdt., Attic
of horsemen or chariots, ἱππικὸς ἀγών, δρόμος Hdt., Soph.
skilled in riding, equestrian, Plat.; ἡ ἱππική Ar.
τὸ ἱππικόν, the horse, cavalry, Hdt., Xen.
a course of four stadia, Plut.
adv. -κῶς, like a horseman: Sup. -κώτατα, with best horsemanship, Xen.

div1.head: ἵππιος
div1.sense: of a horse or horses, Eur.; epith. of the Queen of the Amazons, Eur.; of Poseidon as creator of the horse, Aesch., etc.

div1.head: ἱππιοχαίτης
div1.sense: shaggy with horse-hair, Il.

div1.head: ἱππιοχάρμης
div1.sense: one who fights from a chariot, Hom.: later, a horseman, rider, Aesch.
as adj., ἵππ. κλόνοι the tumult of the horse-fight, Aesch.

div1.head: ἱπποβάμων
div1.sense: going on horseback, equestrian, Aesch., Soph.
metaph., ῥήματα ἱππ. great high-paced words, bombast, Ar.

div1.head: ἱπποβάτης
div1.sense: a horseman, Aesch.

div1.head: ἱπποβότης
div1.sense: feeder of horses, Eur.
the ἱπποβόται at Chalcis in Euboea were a class, like the ἱππεῖς at Athens, Lat. Equites, the Knights, Hdt.

div1.head: ἱππόβοτος
div1.sense: grazed by horses, Hom., Eur.

div1.head: ἱπποβουκόλος
div1.sense: a horse-herd, horse-keeper, Eur.

div1.head: ἱππογέρανοι
div1.sense: crane-cavalry, Luc.

div1.head: ἱππόγυποι
div1.sense: vulture-cavalry, Luc.

div1.head: ἱππόδαμος
div1.sense: tamer of horses, Hom.

div1.head: ἱπποδάσεια
div1.etym: as fem. without any masc. in use,
div1.sense: bushy with horse-hair, of helmets, Hom.

div1.head: ἱππόδεσμα
div1.sense: horse-bands, reins, Eur.

div1.head: ἱπποδέτης
div1.sense: binding horses, Soph.

div1.head: ἱπποδιώκτης
div1.sense: a driver or rider of steeds, Theocr.

div1.head: ἱπποδρομία
div1.sense: a horse-race or chariot-race, Ar., Thuc.

div1.head: ἱπποδρόμος
div1.sense: a light horseman, Hdt.

div1.head: ἱππόδρομος
div1.sense: a chariot-road, Il.
a race-course for chariots, Lat. curriculum, Plat., etc.

div1.head: ἱππόθεν
div1.sense: forth from the horse, Od.

div1.head: ἱπποκάνθαρος
div1.sense: a horse-beetle, Ar.

div1.head: ἱπποκέλευθος
div1.sense: travelling by means of horses, a driver of horses, Il.

div1.head: ἱπποκένταυρος
div1.sense: a horse-centaur, half-horse half-man, Xen.

div1.head: ἱπποκομέω
div1.sense: to groom horses, ἱπποκομεῖν κάνθαρον to groom oneʼs beetle, Ar.

div1.head: ἱππόκομος
div1.sense: decked with horse-hair, of a helmet, Il., Soph.

div1.head: ἱπποκόμος
div1.sense: a groom or esquire, who attended the ἱππεύς in war, Lat. equiso, Hdt., Thuc., etc.

div1.head: ἱπποκορυστής
div1.sense: equipt or furnished with horses, Il.

div1.head: ἱπποκρατέω
div1.sense: to be superior in horse, Dem.:— Pass. to be inferior in horse, Thuc.

div1.head: ἱπποκρατία
div1.sense: victory in a cavalry action, Xen.

div1.head: ἱππόκρημνος
div1.sense: tremendously steep, ἱππόκρημνον ῥῆμα a neck-breaking word, Ar.

div1.head: ἱππόκροτος
div1.sense: sounding with horses, Eur.

div1.head: ἱππόλοφος
div1.sense: with horse-hair crest, Ar., Anth.

div1.head: ἱππομανής
div1.sense: of a meadow, in which horses take mad delight, or, swarming with horses, Soph.
as Subst., ἱππομανές, έος, an Arcadian plant, which makes horses mad, Theocr.

div1.head: ἱππομανία
div1.sense: mad love for horses, Luc.

div1.head: ἱππομαχέω
div1.sense: to fight on horseback, Thuc., Xen.

div1.head: ἱππομαχία
div1.sense: a horse-fight, an action of cavalry, Thuc., etc.

div1.head: ἱππομάχος
div1.sense: fighting on horseback, a trooper, Simon., Luc.

div1.head: ἱππομύρμηξ
div1.sense: a horse-ant: pl. ant-cavalry, Luc.

div1.head: ἱππονώμας
div1.sense: guiding or keeping horses, Soph., Eur.

div1.head: ἱπποπόλος
div1.sense: busied with horses, Il.

div1.head: ἵππος
div1.sense: a horse, mare, Lat. equus, equa, Hom., etc.:—the pl. ἵπποι in Hom. are the chariot-horses, Il.:—hence ἵπποι is used for the chariot itself, καθʼ ἵππων ἅλλεσθαι, ἐξ ἵππων βῆσαι, ἵππων ἐπεβήσετο Il.:—the art of riding, though known to Hom., was an uncommon practice, cf. κέλης, κελητίζω,
as Collective Noun, ἵππος, ἡ, horse, cavalry, Lat. equitatus, Hdt., Attic; always in sg., as ἵππος χιλίη a thousand horse, Hdt.
ὁ ἵππος ὁ ποτάμιος the hippopotamus, Hdt.
in Compos., it expressed anything large or coarse, as in our horsechestnut, horselaugh, v. ἱππόκρημνος, etc.

div1.head: ἱππόστασις
div1.sense: a stable:—metaph., Ἀελίου κνεφαία ἱππόστασις the dark stable of the Sun, i. e. the west, Eur.

div1.head: ἱπποσύνη
div1.sense: the art of chariot-driving, horsemanship, Hom.
= ἵππος II, horse, cavalry, Orac. ap. Hdt.

div1.head: ἱππότης
div1.sense: a driver or rider of horses, a horseman, knight, Lat. eques, Hom., Hdt., etc.
as adj., ἱππότης λεώς the horse, the horsemen, Aesch., Soph.

div1.head: ἱπποτοξότης
div1.sense: a mounted bowman, horse-archer, Hdt., Thuc.

div1.head: ἱπποτροφία
div1.sense: a breeding or keeping of horses, esp. for racing, Simon., Thuc.

div1.head: ἱπποτρόφος
div1.sense: horse-feeding, abounding in horses, Hes.
of persons, breeding and keeping race-horses, Dem., Plut.

div1.head: ἱπποτυφία
div1.sense: horse-pride, i. e. excessive pride, Luc.

div1.head: ἵππουρις
div1.sense: fem. adj. horse-tailed, decked with a horse-tail, of helmets, Hom.

div1.head: ἱπποφόρβιον
div1.sense: a lot of horses out at grass, a troop of horses, Hdt., Xen.
a stable, Eur.

div1.head: ἱπποφορβός
div1.sense: a horse-keeper, Plat.

div1.head: ἱππώδης
div1.sense: horse-like, Xen.

div1.head: ἱππωνία
div1.sense: a buying of horses, Xen.

div1.head: ἱππωνέω
div1.sense: to buy horses, Xen.

div1.head: ἱππών
div1.sense: a place for horses:
a stable, Xen.
a posting-house, station, Xen.

div1.head: ἴπτομαι
div1.sense: fut. ἴψομαι: Epic 2nd sg. aor1 ἴψαο: Dep.:— to press hard, oppress, Il., Theocr.

div1.head: Ἶρις
div1.sense: Iris, the messenger of the gods, Il.
as Appellat. ἶρις, ἡ:— the rainbow, iris, in Hom., as in the Bible, a sign to men, τέρας μερόπων ἀνθρώπων Il.
any bright-coloured circle as that round the eyes of a peacockʼs tail, Luc.
the plant Iris, Theophr.

div1.head: ἰσάγγελος
div1.sense: like an angel, NTest.

div1.head: ἰσάδελφος
div1.sense: like a brother, Eur.

div1.head: ἰσάζω
div1.sense: to make equal, to balance, of a person holding scales, Il.; ἰσ. τὰς κτήσεις to equalise them, Arist.: —Mid. to make oneself equal to another, Il.

div1.head: ἰσάμιλλος
div1.sense: equal in the race: neut. pl. as adv., Anth.

div1.head: ἰσάργυρος
div1.sense: worth its weight in silver, Aesch.

div1.head: ἰσηγορία
div1.sense: equal freedom of speech, equality, Hdt., Xen.

div1.head: ἰσῆλιξ
div1.sense: of the same age with, τινι Xen.

div1.head: Ἰσθμιάς
div1.sense: Isthmian, Thuc.

div1.head: ἴσθμιον
div1.sense: anything on the neck, a necklace, Od.
Ἴσθμια (sc. ἱερά) , τά, the Isthmian games, holden on the Isthmus of Corinth, Ar., etc.

div1.head: ἴσθμιος
div1.sense: Isthmian, Soph.

div1.head: Ἰσθμόθεν
div1.sense: from the Isthmus, Anth.

div1.head: Ἰσθμόθι
div1.sense: on the Isthmus, Anth.

div1.head: Ἰσθμοῖ
div1.sense: on the Isthmus, ap. Plut.

div1.head: ἰσθμός
div1.sense: any narrow passage: esp. a neck of land between two seas, an isthmus, Hdt., Aesch., etc.
ὁ Ἰσθμός was the Isthmus of Corith, Hdt.

div1.head: ἰσθμώδης
div1.sense: like an isthmus, Thuc.

div1.head: Ἰσιακός
div1.sense: of or for Isis:—fem. Ἰσιάς, άδος, ἡ, Anth.

div1.head: Ἶσις
div1.sense: Isis, an Egypt. goddess, answering to the Greek Demeter, Hdt.

div0.div1: ἴσκε Epic for ἔνισπεν, he said, he spake, Od. 1st pers. ἴσκον in Theocr.[See LSJ ἴσκω2 III]

div1.head: ἴσκω
div1.sense: to make like, τί τινι Od.; ἴσκε ψεύδεα πολλὰ λέγων ἐτύμοισιν ὁμοῖα speaking many lies he made them like truths, i. e. seemed to speak truth, Od.
to think like, τινά τινι Il.: absol., ἴσκεν ἕκαστος ἀνήρ every one fancied, i. e. took false for real, Od.
to deem, suppose, Anth.

div1.head: ἰσοβασιλεύς
div1.sense: equal to a king, Plut.

div1.head: ἰσόγαιος
div1.sense: like land, Luc.

div1.head: ἰσογονία
div1.sense: equality of kind, Plat.

div1.head: ἰσοδαίμων
div1.sense: godlike, Aesch.

div1.head: ἰσοδίαιτος
div1.sense: living on an equality, Thuc.

div1.head: ἰσόδρομος
div1.sense: running equally, of equal length, Anth.

div1.head: ἰσοζυγής
div1.sense: evenly balanced: equal, Anth.

div1.head: ἰσόθεος
div1.sense: equal to the gods, godlike, Hom., Attic

div1.head: ἰσοθεόω
div1.sense: to make equal to the gods, Aesop.

div1.head: ἰσοκίνδυνος
div1.sense: equal to the danger or risk, a match for, Thuc.

div1.head: ἰσόκληρος
div1.sense: equal in property, Plut.

div1.head: ἰσοκρατής
div1.sense: of equal power, possessing equal rights with others, Hdt.

div1.head: ἰσομάτωρ
div1.sense: like oneʼs mother, Theocr.

div1.head: ἰσόμαχος
div1.sense: equal in battle, Xen.

div1.head: ἰσομεγέθης
div1.sense: equal in size, Xen.

div1.head: ἰσομέτωπος
div1.sense: with equal front, Xen.

div1.head: ἰσομήκης
div1.sense: equal in length, Plat.

div1.head: ἰσομοιρέω
div1.sense: to have an equal share, Thuc., Xen.

div1.head: ἰσομοιρία
div1.sense: an equal share, partnership, τινός in a thing, Thuc.

div1.head: ἰσόμοιρος
div1.sense: sharing equally or alike, c. gen., Xen.
coextensive, Aesch.; γῆς ἰσόμοιρʼ ἀήρ earthʼs equal partner air, Soph.

div1.head: ἰσόμορος
div1.sense: used by Poseidon of himself as ἰσόμορος with Zeus, Il.

div1.head: ἰσόνειρος
div1.sense: dream-like, empty, Aesch.

div1.head: ἰσόνεκυς
div1.sense: dying equally or alike, Eur.

div1.head: ἰσονομέομαι
div1.sense: Pass. to have equal rights, Thuc.

div1.head: ἰσονομία
div1.sense: equality of rights, the equality of a Greek democracy, Hdt., Thuc.

div1.head: ἰσόνομος
div1.sense: of states, having equal rights, Scol_gr.

div1.head: ἰσόπαις
div1.sense: like a child, as of a child, Aesch.

div1.head: ἰσοπάλαιστος
div1.sense: a span long, Anth.

div1.head: ἰσοπαλής
div1.sense: equal in the struggle, well-matched, Hdt.
generally, equivalent, Thuc.

div1.head: ἰσόπεδον
div1.sense: level ground, a flat, Il., Xen.

div1.head: ἰσόπεδος
div1.sense: of even surface, level or even with, c. dat., Hdt.

div1.head: ἰσοπλατής
div1.sense: equal in breadth, τινι to a thing, Thuc.

div1.head: ἰσοπλάτων
div1.sense: another Plato, Anth.

div1.head: ἰσοπληθής
div1.sense: equal in number or quantity, τινι to a person or thing, Thuc.

div1.head: ἰσόπρεσβυς
div1.sense: like an old man, Aesch.

div1.head: ἰσορροπία
div1.sense: equipoise, equilibrium, Plat.

div1.head: ἰσόρροπος
div1.sense: equally balanced, in equipoise, of the balance, Plat.; metaph. of fortune, Aesch.; of a conflict, Eur.:—c. dat. equally matched with, Hdt.; so, c. gen., in equipoise with, Thuc.

div1.head: ἰσοσκελής
div1.sense: with equal legs, isosceles, Plat.
of numbers, that can be divided into two equal parts, even (as 6 = 3 + 3), Plat.

div1.head: ἴσος
div1.sense: equal to, the same as, c. dat., or absol. equal, like, Hom., etc.:— ἴσα πρὸς ἴσα "measure for measure, " Hdt.; of the mixture of wine with water, ἴσος οἶνος ἴσῳ ὕδατι κεκραμένος Comici; metaph., μηδὲν ἴσον ἴσῳ φέρων not mixing half and half, i. e. not giving tit for tat, Ar.
equally divided, equal, Hom., Soph.:— τὰ ἴσα an equal share, fair measure, Hdt., Soph.:— ἴσαι (sc. ψῆφοι) votes equally divided, Ar.

at Athens, of the equal division of all civic rights, Thuc., etc.:— τὰ ἴσα equal rights, equality, Dem.:—also, ἡ ἴση καὶ ὁμοία (sc. δίκη) Thuc., etc.; ἐπʼ ἴσῃ τε καὶ ὁμοίῃ on fair and equal terms, Hdt.
of persons, fair, impartial, Soph., Plat., etc.
of ground, even, level, flat, Lat. aequus, εἰς τὸ ἴσον καταβαίνειν, of an army, Xen.
adv., ἴσως, v. sub voc.:—but there are other adverbial forms,

neut. sg., ἶσον Κηρί even as Death, Il.; ἶσον ἐμοί like me, Il., etc.; ἴσον τῷ πρίν equally as before, Eur.; followed by καί, ἴσα καί . . like as, as if, Lat. aeque ac, Soph., etc.:—absol. alike, Soph.
with Preps.: —ἀπο τῆς ἴσης equally, Lat. ex aequo, Thuc.; ἀπʼ ἴσης Dem.:— ἐν ἴσῳ equally, Thuc., etc.;— ἐξ ἴσου Hdt., Attic:— ἐπὶ ἴσης, later ἐπίσης, Hdt., Attic
Attic comp. ἰσαίτερος Eur., etc.

div1.head: ἰσοστάσιος
div1.sense: in equipoise with, equivalent to, τινι Plut., Luc.

div1.head: ἰσοτέλεια
div1.sense: the condition of an ἰσοτελής, equality in tax and tribute, Xen.

div1.head: ἰσοτέλεστος
div1.sense: fulfilled alike, ὁ ἐπίκουρος ἰσ., the ally that comes to all alike, of Death, Soph.

div1.head: ἰσοτελής
div1.sense: paying alike, bearing equal burdens: at Athens, the ἰσοτελεῖς were a class of μέτοικοι, who needed no patron (προστάτης) and paid no alien-tax (μετοίκιον) , Lys., etc.

div1.head: ἰσότης
div1.sense: equality, Eur., etc.

div1.head: ἰσοτιμία
div1.sense: equality of privilege, Luc.

div1.head: ἰσότιμος
div1.sense: held in equal honour, having the same privileges, Plut., etc.

div1.head: ἰσοφαρίζω
div1.sense: to match oneself with, be a match for, cope with, c. dat., Il.

div1.head: ἰσοφόρος
div1.sense: bearing or drawing equal weights, equal in strength, Od.

div1.head: ἰσοχειλής
div1.sense: level with the brim, Xen.

div1.head: ἰσόχνοος
div1.sense: equally woolly with, τινι Anth.

div1.head: ἰσοψηφία
div1.sense: equal right to vote, Plut.

div1.head: ἰσόψηφος
div1.sense: with or by an equal number of votes, Aesch.
having an equal vote with others, equal in authority, Eur., Thuc.

div1.head: ἰσόψυχος
div1.sense: of equal spirit, κράτος ἰσ. Aesch.
of like soul or mind, NTest.

div1.head: ἰσόω
div1.sense: to make equal, Soph., Ar., etc.:—Mid., ὄνυχας χεῖράς τε ἰσώσαντο, i. e. used them in like manner, Hes.:—Pass. to be made like or equal to, c. dat., Od., Soph.

div1.head: ἴς
div1.sense: a muscle, esp. the muscle at the back of the neck, Il.:—in pl. the muscles, Hom.
strength, force, Lat. vis, Hom.:—in periphr. like βίη, ἱερὴ ἲς Τηλεμάχοιο the strong Telemachus, Od., etc.

div1.head: ἱστάνω
div1.etym: late form of ἵστημι, NTest., etc.

div1.head: ἵστημι
div1.sense: Causal Tenses, to make to stand, Lat. sisto,
intr. to stand, Lat. sto,
Causal, to make to stand, set, Hom., etc.:— to set men in array, post them, Il., Xen.
to make to stand, stop, stay, check, Hom., etc.; στῆσαι τὴν φάλαγγα to halt it, Xen.; στ. τὰ ὄμματα to fix them, of a dying man, Plat.; ἵ. τὸ πρόσωπον, Lat. componere vultum, Xen.

to set up, ἱστ. ἱστόν to set up the loom, or to raise the mast, Hom.; to raise buildings, statues, trophies, etc., Hdt., Attic; ἱστάναι τινὰ χαλκοῦν to set him up in brass, raise a brasen statue to him, Dem.
to raise, rouse, stir up, Hom., etc.; φυλόπιδα στήσειν to stir up strife, Od.; in aor1 mid., στήσασθαι μάχην Od.
to set up, appoint, τινὰ βασιλέα Hdt.; Pass., ὁ σταθεὶς ὕπαρχος Hdt.
to establish, institute a festival, Hdt., Attic
to place in the balance, weigh, Il., etc.; ἱστάναι τι πρός τι to weigh one thing against another, Hdt.

Pass. and intr. tenses of Act. to be set or placed, to stand, Hom.:—often merely for εἶναι, to be there, Od., etc.; with an adv. to be in a certain state or condition, ἵνα χρείας ἕσταμεν in what a state of need we are, Soph., etc.
to lie, be situated, Thuc.
to stand still, stop, halt, Hom.: to stand idle, Il.: to stop, cease, be at rest, Il.
metaph. to stand firm, Xen.
to stand up, rise up, Il.; of a horse, ἵστασθαι ὀρθός to rear up, Hdt.
to arise, begin, Il.

in marking Time, ἔαρος ἱσταμένοιο as spring was beginning, Od.; ἕβδομος ἑστήκει μείς the seventh month began, Il.; τοῦ μὲν φθίνοντος μηνός, τοῦ δʼ ἱσταμένοιο as one month ends and the next begins, Od.; the month in Hom. being divided into two parts, ἱστάμενος and φθίνων; but in the Attic Calendar, it fell into three decads, ἱστάμενος, μεσῶν, φθίνων, Hdt., Thuc.
to be appointed, στῆναι ἐς ἀρχήν Hdt.

div1.head: ἱστίον
div1.sense: any web, a sail, ἱστία στέλλεσθαι, μηρύεσθαι, καθελεῖν to lower or furl sail, Od.; ἄκροισι χρῆσθαι ἱστίοις to keep the sails close-reefed, Ar.

div1.head: ἱστοβοεύς
div1.sense: the plough-tree or pole, Hes.

div1.head: ἱστοδόκη
div1.sense: the mast-crutch, on which the mast rested when let down, Il.

div1.head: ἱστοπέδη
div1.sense: a hole in the keel for stepping the mast, Od.

div1.head: ἱστόποδες
div1.sense: the long beams of the loom, Anth.

div1.head: ἱστοπόνος
div1.sense: working at the loom, Anth.

div1.head: ἱστορέω
div1.sense: to inquire into a thing, to learn by inquiry, Hdt., Aesch., etc.; to examine, and in perf. sense, to know, Aesch.
c. acc. pers. to inquire of, ask, Hdt., Eur.:—Pass. to be questioned, Eur.
c. acc. pers. also to inquire about one, Soph., Eur.
c. dupl. acc. to inquire of one about a thing, Eur.
absol. to inquire, Hdt.
to narrate what one has learnt, Arist., Luc.

div1.head: ἱστορία
div1.sense: a learning by inquiry, inquiry, Hdt., Plat.
the knowledge so obtained, information, Hdt.
an account of oneʼs inquiries, a narrative, history, Arist.

div1.head: ἱστορικός
div1.sense: of or for inquiry: historical, Plut.

div1.head: ἱστός
div1.sense: anything set upright:
a shipʼs mast, ἱστὸν στῆσαι or στήσασθαι to step the mast, Hom.:— a rod, pole, Hdt.

the beam of the loom, which stood upright, instead of lying horizontal as in our looms, Hom.; ἱστὸν στήσασθαι to set up the beam and so begin a web, Hes.; ἱστὸν ἐποίχεσθαι to traverse the loom, because the weaver was obliged to walk to and fro, Hom.
the warp that was fixed to the beam, the web, Hom.

div1.head: ἱστότονος
div1.sense: stretched in the loom, Ar.

div1.head: ἱστουργέω
div1.sense: to work at the loom, Soph.

div1.head: ἱστουργία
div1.sense: weaving, Plat.

div1.head: ἴστωρ
div1.sense: a wise man, one who knows right, a judge, Il.
as adj. knowing, Hes.; ἵστωρ τινός knowing a thing, Soph.

div1.head: ἴσχαιμος
div1.sense: staunching blood, Luc.

div1.head: ἰσχαλέος
div1.sense: thin, Od.

div1.head: ἰσχανάω
div1.sense: to hold back, check, Hom.
c. gen. to cling to, long after, desire eagerly, Hom.

div1.head: ἰσχάνω
div1.sense: to check, hinder, Il.:—c. gen. to keep back from, Hes.

div1.head: ἰσχάς
div1.sense: a dried fig, Ar.

div1.head: ἰσχίον
div1.sense: the hip-joint, Hom.
in pl. the fleshy parts round the hip-joint, the haunches, hams, Il., Hdt.

div1.head: ἰσχναίνω
div1.sense: to make dry or withered, to dry up, Hdt., Attic:—metaph., θυμὸν ἰσχναίνειν to bring down a proud stomach, Aesch.; τὴν τέχνην ἴσχνανα I refined the art (Tragedy), Ar.

div1.head: ἰσχνοπάρειος
div1.sense: with withered cheeks, Anth.

div1.head: ἰσχνός
div1.sense: dry, withered, lean, meagre, Ar.

div1.head: ἰσχνόφωνος
div1.sense: checked in oneʼs voice, stuttering, stammering, Hdt.

div1.head: ἰσχυρίζομαι
div1.sense: to make oneself strong, to be strong, gain force, Xen.
to contend stoutly, to persist obstinately in doing, c. part., Thuc.: esp. to maintain stiffly, obstinately, Thuc., Plat.
to put firm trust in a thing, c. dat., Dem.

div1.head: ἰσχυριστέος
div1.sense: one must maintain, Plat.

div1.head: ἰσχυρός
div1.sense: strong, mighty, Hdt., Soph.; τὸ ἰσχυρόν strength, vigour, Thuc.; τὰ ἰσχυρότατα your strongest points, Thuc.:— hard, χθών Aesch.
obstinate, stiff, stubborn, inveterate, excessive, severe, Hdt., Thuc.
adv. -ρῶς, strongly, with all force, Thuc.:— exceedingly, Hdt., Xen.

div1.head: ἰσχύς
div1.sense: strength of body, Attic, Hes.; a fortified place, Thuc.
might, power, force, Aesch., etc.; κατʼ ἰσχύν perforce, Aesch.; πρὸς ἰσχύος χάριν Eur.
a force of soldiers, Xen.

div1.head: ἰσχύω
div1.sense: to be strong in body, Soph., Xen., etc.
to be strong, mighty, powerful, prevail, Aesch., etc.; πλέον, μεῖζον ἰσχ. Eur.; ἰσχ. παρά τινι to have power or influence with one, Thuc.

div1.head: ἴσχω
div1.etym: a form of ἔχω only in pres. and impf.
div1.sense: to hold, check, curb, keep back, restrain, Hom.:—c. gen. to keep from, Il., Eur., etc.; also, ἴσχ. τινὰ μὴ πράσσειν Eur.

intr., ἴσχε hold, stay, stop, Aesch.; of ships, to lie at anchor, Thuc.:—so in Pass., ἴσχεσθʼ Ἀργεῖοι, μὴ φεύγετε Od.; ἴσχεο Hom.:—c. gen., ἴσχεσθαί τινος to desist from, Od.: ἴσχετο impers., here it stopped, Xen.
to hold fast, hold, maintain, Il., Soph.
like ἔχω, to hold or have in possession, to have, Hdt., Attic: to have a wife, Hdt.: to have a child, Hdt.
intr., with an adv., to be so and so, Thuc.

div1.head: ἴσως
div1.sense: equally, in like manner, Soph.: Sup. ἰσαίτατα Plat.
equally, fairly, equitably, Dem.
probably, perhaps, Hdt., Attic;—in Attic often joined with ἄν or τάχʼ ἄν, Soph., etc.
with numerals, about, Ar.

div1.head: Ἰταλία
div1.sense: Italy, Hdt., etc.

div1.head: Ἰταλιώτης
div1.sense: an Italiote, i. e. a Greek inhabitant of Italy, Thuc.:—fem. Ἰταλιῶτις, ιδος, adj. Italian, Thuc.

div1.head: ἰταλός
div1.sense: = ταῦρος, whence Italy is said to be derived, cf. Lat. vitulus.

div1.head: Ἰταλός
div1.sense: Italian:—as adj., Anth.

div1.head: ἰταμός
div1.sense: headlong, hasty, eager, ready for anything, reckless, Lat. audax, Aesch., Dem.

div1.head: ἰτέα
div1.sense: a willow, Lat. salix, Il., Hdt., etc.
a wicker shield, target, Eur.

div1.head: ἰτέϊνος
div1.sense: of willow, Lat. salignus, Hdt.; made of wicker, Theocr.

div1.head: ἰτέος
div1.sense: one must go, Plat.

div1.head: ἰτός
div1.sense: passable, Anth.

div1.head: ἰτρίνεος
div1.sense: like a cake, Anth.

div1.head: ἴτριον
div1.sense: a cake of sesame and honey, Ar.

div1.head: ἴττω
div1.etym: Boeot. for ἴστω, 3rd sg. imperat. of οἶδα
div1.sense: ἴττω Ζεύς Zeus be witness! Ar., Plat.

div1.head: ἴτυς
div1.sense: a circle made of willow (cf. ἰτέα) : of the felloe of a wheel, Il.:— the edge or rim of a shield, Hes., Hdt.; the round shield itself, Eur., Xen.

div1.head: ἰυγή
div1.sense: a howling, shrieking, yelling, as of men in pain, Orac. ap. Hdt., Soph.

div1.head: ἰυγμός
div1.sense: a shouting, shout of joy, Il.
a cry of pain, shriek, Aesch., Eur.

div1.head: ἴυγξ
div1.sense: the wryneck, so called from its cry. The ancient witches used to bind it to a wheel, believing that, as it turned, it drew menʼs hearts along with it, Xen., Theocr.
metaph. a spell, charm, passionate yearning for, c. gen., Aesch.

div1.head: ἰύζω
div1.sense: to shout, yell, Hom.:—later to yell or cry from grief or pain, Aesch., Soph.
div1.etym: ῑ, Epic and Pind.; ι in Soph.

div1.head: ἰυκτής
div1.sense: one who shouts or yells: also, a singer, whistler, piper, Theocr.

div1.head: ἴφθιμος
div1.sense: stout, strong, stalwart, Il.:—of women, comely, goodly, Hom.

div1.head: Ἰφιγένεια
div1.sense: strong-born:—as prop. n. Iphigeneia, Agamemnonʼs daughter, Trag.; called Ἰφιάνασσα by Hom.

div1.head: ἴφιος
div1.sense: stout, fat, goodly, of sheep, Hom.

div1.head: ἶφι
div1.etym: Epic adv., an old dat. of ἴς,
div1.sense: strongly, stoutly, mightily, Hom.

div1.head: ἰχθυάω
div1.sense: to fish, angle, Epic imperf. ἰχθυάασκον Od.; c. acc. to fish for, Epic 3rd sg. ἰχθυάᾳ Od.
to sport, of fish, Hes.

div1.head: ἰχθυβολέω
div1.sense: to strike fish, Anth.

div1.head: ἰχθυβόλος
div1.sense: striking fish, ἰχθ. μηχανή, of the trident, Aesch.
as Subst. a fisher, angler, Anth.
pass., ἰχθ. θήρα a spoil of speared fish, Anth.

div1.head: ἰχθυβόρος
div1.sense: fish-eating, Anth.

div1.head: ἰχθύδιον
div1.sense: a little fish, Anth.

div1.head: ἰχθυδόκος
div1.sense: holding fish, Anth.

div1.head: ἰχθυηρός
div1.sense: fishy, scaly, i. e. foul, dirty, Ar.

div1.head: ἰχθυοειδής
div1.sense: fish-like, of fishes, Hdt.

div1.head: ἰχθυόεις
div1.sense: full of fish, fishy, Hom.
consisting of fish, Anth.

div1.head: ἰχθυοθηρητήρ
div1.sense: a fisherman, Anth.

div1.head: ἰχθυολύμης
div1.sense: plague of fish, of a fisheater, Ar.

div1.head: ἰχθυοτρόφος
div1.sense: feeding fish: full of fish, Plut.

div1.head: ἰχθυοφάγος
div1.sense: fish-eating:— οἱ Ἰχθ. ἄνδρες the fish-eaters, a tribe on the Arabian Gulf, Hdt.

div1.head: ἰχθυπαγής
div1.sense: piercing fish, Anth.

div1.head: ἰχθυσιληϊστήρ
div1.sense: a stealer of fish, Anth.

div1.head: ἰχθύς
div1.sense: a fish, Hom., etc.
in pl., οἱ ἰχθῦς the fish-market, Ar.

div1.head: ἰχθυώδης
div1.sense: full of fish, Hdt.

div1.head: Ἰχναῖος
div1.sense: following on the track, Hhymn.

div1.head: ἰχνεία
div1.sense: a casting about for the scent, of hounds, Xen.

div1.head: ἰχνελάτης
div1.sense: one who pursues the track, Anth.

div1.head: ἰχνεύμων
div1.sense: the tracker: an Egyptian animal of the weasel-kind, which hunts out crocodileʼs eggs, the ichneumon, Pharaohʼs rat, Arist.

div1.head: ἴχνευσις
div1.sense: a tracking, Xen.

div1.head: ἰχνευτής
div1.sense: a tracker, ἰχν. κύων a hound that hunts by nose, Anth.
= ἰχνεύμων, Hdt.

div1.head: ἰχνεύω
div1.sense: to track out, hunt after, seek out, Soph., Eur.: metaph., τὴν ψῆφον ἰχν. seeking for the vote of condemnation, Ar.
ἰχν. ὄρη to hunt the mountains, Xen.

div1.head: ἴχνιον
div1.sense: a track, trace, footstep, Hom.

div1.head: ἰχνοπέδη
div1.sense: a kind of fetter or trap, Anth.

div1.head: ἰχνοσκοπέω
div1.sense: to examine the track, Aesch.

div1.head: ἴχνος
div1.sense: a track, footstep, Od., Hdt., etc.: metaph. a track, trace, clue, Trag.
poet. a foot or leg, Eur.

div1.head: ἰχώρ
div1.sense: ichor, the etherial juice, that flows in the veins of gods, Il.;—Epic acc. ἰχῶ for ἰχῶρα, Il.: later blood, Aesch.

div1.head: ἴψ
div1.sense: a worm that eats horn and wood, Od.

div1.head: ἰωγή
div1.sense: shelter, Βορέω ὑπʼ ἰωγῇ under shelter from the north-wind, Od.

div1.head: ἰωή
div1.sense: any loud sound: the shout or cry of men, Il.; the sound of the lyre, Od.; of the wind, of a fire, Il.

div1.head: ἰωκή
div1.sense: rout, pursuit, Il.:— Ἰωκή is personified Il.
div1.etym: metaplast. acc. ἴωκα (as if from ἰώξ) , Il.

div1.head: ἰωνιά
div1.sense: a violet-bed, Lat. violarium, Ar.

div1.head: Ἰωνικός
div1.sense: Ionic, Ionian, i. e. effeminate, Ar.

div1.head: Ἴων
div1.sense: Ion, the son of Xuthus (or Apollo) and Creusa, from whom sprung the Ionian race, Hdt.

div1.head: ἰώ
div1.sense: an exclamation of joy, as in Lat. io triumphe! Trag.
of grief or suffering, oh! Trag.

div1.head: Ἰώ
div1.sense: Io, daughter of Inachus, Hdt., etc.

div1.head: ἰῶτα
div1.sense: the letter iota, proverb. of anything very small, the smallest letter, a jot (the Hebr. yod), NTest.

div1.head: ἰῶτα
div1.sense: Ι, ι, ἰῶτα, τό, indecl., ninth letter of the Gr. alphabet: as numeral ι 10, but ι 10, 000. The ι subscriptum was called ι προσγεγραμμένον, adscriptum, and was so written till the 13th century, τῶι (not τῷ) , as is still done in capital letters ΤΩΙ., Changes of ι:

Doric, ι for υ in the 3rd pl. and part. pres., as φιλέοισι ἐοῖσα for φιλέουσι, etc.; so also Μοῖσα Ἀρέθοισα for Μοῦσα, etc.:—it was added to α in some Adjs., and in the aor1 part., as μέλαις τάλαις ῥίψαις for μέλας, etc.; and in the acc. pl. fem. of 1st decl., as ταῖς νύμφαις for τὰς νύμφας.
Boeot. and Lacon. as σιός, σεῖος, for θεός, θεῖος.

ῑ easily passes into ει, whence forms like εἴλω ἴλλω, εἴλη ἴλη, εἴρην ἰρήν: ι was sometimes exchanged with ε, as in ἑστία, Ionic ἱστίη:—often inserted to lengthen the syll., e. g. εἰν εἰς ξεῖνος κεινός πνείω ὑπείρ διαί μεταί παραί, for ἐν, ἐς, etc. The Quantity of ι varies.
